description:
First supervised practice experience for Bachelor of Social Work students, commencing two weeks prior to semester for 17 weeks, four days a week, in social welfare agency, totaling 476 hours. Focuses on integration of practice experience with course material to date and companion courses. 
Students are expected to attend pre-placement workshops on February 14 and 15, 2010 with placement starting on February 16, 2011 (End Date - 9th June 2011). 
Prospective students are advised to contact the Field Education Unit, to arrange a pre-placement interview, in the month of August prior to going on placement in the first semester of the following year. Please visit the Field Education page on the School wesbite for further information www.uq.edu.au/swahs
prerequisites:
SWSP2088 or 3211 (SW248 or 361)
Students must complete Years 1 and 2 of the BSW program before being permitted to enter SWSP3077
restricted: This course is restricted to Bachelor of Social Work Students
